title: Hampton Inn Pittsburgh/Greentree Hotel
review_list:
See title. Chose this location based on recommendation and proximity to events we were going to. All was fine except for the paper-thin walls; we could hear the cackling hens next to us the entire evening and morning.

Room was very clean and comfortable, breakfast was fantastic, staff very helpful, and the location perfect for our needs. We wanted to be close to Pittsburgh to enjoy the city, but still have comfortable parking. This spot gave us both.

Exceptional stay. Friendly and helpful staff. Room well appointed. Very clean everywhere. Good breakfast. Comfy bed. Stayed with my dog. Lots of room to walk him outside. Wish more HH accepted larger dogs.

Fantastic place to stay. Very clean and the housekeeping staff goes out of their way to ensure everything is spotless and appealing. I stay here a lot for business. The hotel is always clean and neat. The staff is pleasant and easy to deal with. The rooms are a bit on the small side but they work for me. The breakfast is like all other Hamptons. The price is usually always good. I recommend staying here. This hotle is pet friendly and...


More  



We booked this hotel because of its location. Easy to get into the city and onto the parkway west. When the major storm hit the staff made the necessary moves for us to spend another night. They do have a shuttle service to major sites in the city
.

The only problem we had was that the king bed with sofa bed room was tight for a family of four traveling with two dogs. Other than that, everything was great!

title: Omni William Penn Hotel, Pittsburgh
review_list:
My wife and I stayed here for a weekend get-a--way. The service was outstanding. The room was ready when we arrived and was clean and inviting.. The bed was very comfortable. The food and service at the restaurant wass top shelf. We will definitely stay here again.

The hotel staff goes out of its way to make you welcome. Room requests are taken seriously and everyone seems to want to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. We had a two day business meeting with hotel catered meals. Every one of them was greatly improved in quality from previous years. Rooms were clean, comfortable and quiet.

The hotel food is very good in all resturants; the rooms I would rate as good and clean, but there needs to be updating. I have stayed there many times and I prefer soft beds, their beds are too hard.

The hotel is absolutely beautiful and charming in every way. Everyone in the hotel was friendly and helpful. Room service was quick and delicious. You could tell it came right up to our room when it was ready.
Definitely one of the nicer hotels in town.

I have been going to this hotel for so many years. It is so beautiful and grand. You will not be disappointed. The beds are comfy, The food is excellent and the staff is so friendly. You are a short walk to the a lot of restaurants and events in the city.

All the staff at this hotel need some training on how to treat guests at the hotel. The service in all areas from the doormen, to waiters in the restaurant was poor to terrible. I was left with the feeling that the staff did not care about me or their job. I can not recommend this hotel based on the...


More  



Simply beautiful! Our upper level suite had a separate sitting area, entire suite had several very convenient outlets for charging devices. Built in automatic lighting in the nightstands (at floor level) so no need to turn on the lights in the middle of the night. Lamps are on dimmers which we find very useful. Omni Rewards offers coffee delivery in...


More  



I stayed here for a night on a little girls trip out of town. This hotel is absolutely stunning, and the staff is friendly as well. What really impressed me was the attention to detail. From the cotton swabs and q-tips in the bathroom, to the motion sensor foot lights in between the beds. I will definitely be back!

Each Christmas, I take my daughter and three of her friends to high tea at the William Penn and it is fabulous. I have stayed at the hotel and it is a treat. Great location downtown Pittsburgh - close to the hockey arena.

We came into downtown Pittsburgh for a United Way event and decided to take the opportunity to stay at the William Penn. We have spent many nights there since living abroad and visiting our family in Pittsburgh on holiday. Now living outside of Pittsburgh, staying at the William Penn seems like we're at a second home.

Some Microtel Inns are great. This is bit one if then. The room was in need of upgrading and better maintenance. The staff was. It particularly welcoming. Once was enough. I found better places to stay in the area.

If you want a lot of amenities then this is not the place to stay. The rooms are very small and compact. Not good for families unless you have a suite and then I wouldn't recommend for families. Clean and decently priced. No pool. A average stop and go, not a park and stay.

Clean sheets and towels in an otherwise wornout hotel. This is no longer a Microtel but is now an Econolodge. It is overdue for a renovation and a deep cleaning in the common areas. It is OK for a quick stay before or after a flight but don't expect much.

Well I booked the room because I traveled with my children and POOL was one of the amenities. when I checked in I asked what time does the pool close and she told me that there was no pool. I was pissed. Never again!!!!!

Have been here before and received a great deal from booking.com Would probably not return as the bed was one of the most uncomfortable beds ever. Wonderful and very helpful staff. clean room. less than average continental breakfast with waffles.convenient location in Robinson township.
